tool_description: 4eat API is the Digital Nutritionist infrastructure for the internet. It provides you with an easy and advanced digital nutritionist that you can integrate into your service. We aim to add value to verticals related to nutrition services, so we can improve people's life through better health, which starts with better nutrition.
name: 4eat
title: 4eat

api_list.name: get-user
api_list.description: This endpoint provides you all the information of a specific user. This will be useful to present to the user specific information. To update any of those values, you need to use ```PUT /user```
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/user"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/user"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

planType.title: planType
planType.description:
Defines the type of plan for the user.

- **1** = Automatic plan. The week is pre-filled with the best healthy options for each meal.  
- **2** = Manual plan. The week is empty and each meal can be selected manually following our nutrition logic.

weight.title: weight
weight.description: Defines the weight of the user in kilograms. We use the weight to determine the right amount of each ingredient on every meal

height.title: height
height.description: Defines the height of the user in centimeters

age.title: age
age.description: Defines the age of the user in years

gender.title: gender
gender.description:
Defines the gender of the user

- **1** = male
- **2** = female

dietID.title: dietID
dietID.description:
Defines the diet type of the user

- **1** = without restrictions
- **2** = vegan

modeID.title: modeID
modeID.description:
Defines the diet mode of the user. It determines the way we select the available recipes and the ingredients quantities optimization

- **1** = healthy
- **2** = lose weight
- **3** = gain muscle

langID.title: langID
langID.description: Defines the language ID used to show the texts. See the list of available languages with ```GET /setupData``` method

countryID.title: countryID
countryID.description: Defines the country ID associated to the user. We use the country to optimice the available recipes for the user. See the list of available countries with ```GET /setupData``` method

signupDate.description: Defines the date when the user was signed up in seconds since 1970 (epoch)

mealsDistributions.title: mealsDistributionsArray
mealsDistributions.description: Defines a list of every meals distribution for several days (up to seven)

items.title: mealsDistributionsObject
items.description: Defines the meals distribution for a given day ID

dayID.title: dayID
dayID.description: Defines the day ID inside a week. Each plan represents one week and have 7 days associated to it

mealsNumber.title: mealsNumber
mealsNumber.description: Defines the number of meals per day for a plan

mealsDistribution.title: mealsDistribution
mealsDistribution.description: Defines the meals distribution for a day, i.e. the combination of the meal types. There are 3 distributions for every different number of meals. See the list of every available distribution with ```GET /setupData``` method

constraints.description: Defines the list of the existing constraints for the user

constraintID.title: constraintID
constraintID.description: Defines the constraint ID for a user. This could be an allergy or ingredient you want to exclude from the user's plan

type.title: constraintType
type.description:
Defines the type of the constraint

- **1** = standard allergy (see list of every available allergy with ```GET /setupData``` method)
- **2** = ingredient allergy
- **3** = ingredient dislike

name.title: constraintName
name.description: Defines the name of the constraint

api_list.name: post-getDislikes
api_list.description: Displays the list of ingredients that the user can indicate as disliked. We'll remove these from his diet
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/dislikes"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/dislikes"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: post-getRecipes
api_list.description:
This endpoint will provide you a list with all the recipes that you have available as a customer. This includes our recipes, if enabled, and the recipes that you can create. Consider that this method should not be used for user diet selections, as we have a specific endpoint for those cases, where we optimize which recipes can be selected in a meal.

This is a list that you can use to review and check your recipes and analyze the available recipes, but not as a meal selection tool.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/recipes"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/recipes"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

recipeID.title: recipeID
recipeID.description: Defines the recipe ID. See the list of every available recipe with ```GET /recipes``` method

ownRecipe.description: Defines if the recipe has been created by you

name.title: recipeName
name.description: Defines the name of the recipe

subcategoryName.title: subcategoryName
subcategoryName.description: Defines the name of the recipe's subcategory. See the list of every available subcategory with ```GET /setupData``` method

api_list.name: post-getAllergies
api_list.description: Displays the list of allergies and ingredients that the user can indicate as allergy. We'll remove these from his diet
api_list.code:

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/allergies"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/allergies"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

constraints.description: Defines the list of constraints that can be selected as standard allergy (type 1) or ingredient allergy (type 2)

constraintID.title: constraintID
constraintID.description: Defines the constraint ID for a user. This could be an allergy or ingredient you want to exclude from the user's plan

type.title: constraintType
type.description:
Defines the type of the constraint

- **1** = standard allergy (see list of every available allergy with ```GET /setupData``` method)
- **2** = ingredient allergy
- **3** = ingredient dislike

name.title: constraintName
name.description: Defines the name of the constraint

api_list.name: post-getCustomerSetup
api_list.description:
This endpoint is a generic function that provides all the relevant information for you as a customer to setup your environment. As a response, we provide the list of countries, languages, subcategories of ingredients, ingredients, subcategories of recipes, allergies, etc.

This is a critical endpoint that you will need to define several properties and to get some important data as ingredients, in order to define your own recipes.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/setupData"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/setupData"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

countries.description: Defines the list of available countries

langs.description: Defines the list of available languages

ingredients.description: Defines the list of available ingredients

subcategories.description: Defines the list of available recipe subcategories

ingredientsGroups.description: Defines the list of available ingredient groups

allergies.description: Defines the list of available allergies

nutrients.description: Defines the list of available nutrients

mealTypes.description: Defines the list of available meal types. Each meal of the week will have a mealType associated to it

mealDistributions.description: Defines the list of available meals distributions

api_list.name: post-getRecipeImage
api_list.description: This endpoint provides you the image associated to the requested recipe from 4eat. As your recipes are defined by yourself, and only you have access to them, you will be in charge of the images for your own recipes. If you decide to use our recipes, this endpoint gives you those images.

optional_parameters.name: thumb
optional_parameters.description: Add ```/thumb``` to endpoint to get recipe thumbnail image

api_list.name: post-getShoppingList
api_list.description:
This endpoint returns the list of ingredients and their quantities for a range of weeks, days or meals. You can select as many ranges as you need, to get the specific list of ingredients that you need.

For every range, you can define:
- Week
- Week and day
- Week, day and meal

We also convert the quantities to a measurement that makes sense depending on the ingredient (grams, units, slices, etc)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/shoppingList"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/shoppingList"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

items.title: ingredientShoppingListObject
items.description: Defines the shopping list quantity for an ingredient for the specified ranges

ingredientID.title: ingredientID
ingredientID.description: Defines the ingredient ID. See the list of every available ingredient with ```GET /setupData``` method

quantity.title: ingredientQuantity
quantity.description: Defines the quantity of ingredient in the most appropiate measurement. If ```null```, it means that the quantity is free of choice for the user, since the nutritional contribution of this ingredient is not very relevant

measurement.title: ingredientMeasurement
measurement.description: Defines the text for the measurement

api_list.name: get-recipeForMeal
api_list.description:
This method provides your users the list of available recipes for a meal.

Available means that they meet the nutritional requirements for the user in that specific moment, considering the rest of the meals already selected. Our algorithms ensure that the alternatives that your users can select at each meal are fitted to their requirements in terms of amounts, allergies, likes and dislikes, macronutrients and ingredients balance.

This can be used to select a blank meal or to replace an existing recipe on that meal.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/recipeForMeal"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://4eat.p.rapidapi.com/recipeForMeal"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "4eat.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: post-getWeek
api_list.description: This method returns a previously generated week for a user.

week.title: weekObject
week.description: Defines a plan for a week

weekID.title: weekID
weekID.description: Defines the week ID for a diet plan. Each user can have several weeks generated, each one indentified with this parameter

dayID.title: dayID
dayID.description: Defines the day ID inside a week. Each plan represents one week and have 7 days associated to it

mealsNumber.title: mealsNumber
mealsNumber.description: Defines the number of meals per day for a plan

mealsDistribution.title: mealsDistribution
mealsDistribution.description: Defines the meals distribution for a day, i.e. the combination of the meal types. There are 3 distributions for every different number of meals. See the list of every available distribution with ```GET /setupData``` method

items.title: mealObject
items.description:
Defines a meal. 

If recipe ID it's equal to -1, it means that there are no recipe associated to that meal. For example, all meals will be blank by default using the manual plan type, or if you use ```PUT /skipMeal``` on a meal

mealID.title: mealID
mealID.description: Defines the meal ID inside a day. Each day can have up to 5 meals associated to it

mealType.title: mealType
mealType.description:
Defines the type of a meal.

- **1** = breakfast
- **2** = noon snack
- **3** = lunch
- **4** = afternoon snack
- **5** = dinner
- **6** = supper

recipeID.title: recipeID
recipeID.description: Defines the recipe ID. See the list of every available recipe with ```GET /recipes``` method

name.title: recipeName
name.description: Defines the name of the recipe

subcategoryName.title: subcategoryName
subcategoryName.description: Defines the name of the recipe's subcategory. See the list of every available subcategory with ```GET /setupData``` method

level.title: recipeLevel
level.description: Defines the difficulty for cooking the recipe, from 1 to 3 (the highest, the harder)

time.title: recipeTime
time.description: Defines the approximate time for cooking the recipe, in minutes

done.title: mealDone
done.description: Defines if a meal has been done by the user. We use this information to better optimice the plan and quantities

custom.title: customRecipe
custom.description: Defines if the recipe has been created by the user (using ```POST /userRecipe```)

ingredients.title: ingredientQuantityArray
ingredients.description: Defines a list of ingredients with associated quantities

items.title: ingredientQuantityObject

ingredientID.title: ingredientID
ingredientID.description: Defines the ingredient ID. See the list of every available ingredient with ```GET /setupData``` method

grams.title: ingredientGrams
grams.description: Defines the quantity of ingredient in grams

quantity.title: ingredientQuantity
quantity.description: Defines the quantity of ingredient in the most appropiate measurement. If ```null```, it means that the quantity is free of choice for the user, since the nutritional contribution of this ingredient is not very relevant

measurement.title: ingredientMeasurement
measurement.description: Defines the text for the measurement

items.description: Defines the required quantity for an ingredient. If you defined a fixed quantity for your own recipe, ```quantity``` and ```measurement``` fields won't appear
